segments.en: Numbered Discourses 7
1. Wealth
7. With Ugga

segments.pli: Atha kho uggo rājamahāmatto yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho uggo rājamahāmatto bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then Ugga the government minister went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him,
“It’s incredible, sir, it’s amazing!

segments.pli: Yāva aḍḍho cāyaṃ, bhante, migāro rohaṇeyyo yāva mahaddhano yāva mahābhogo”ti.
segments.en: Migāra of Rohaṇa is so rich, so very wealthy.”

segments.pli: “Kīva aḍḍho panugga, migāro rohaṇeyyo, kīva mahaddhano, kīva mahābhogo”ti?
segments.en: “But Ugga, how rich is he?”

segments.pli: “Sataṃ, bhante, satasahassānaṃ hiraññassa, ko pana vādo rūpiyassā”ti.
segments.en: “He has a hundred thousand gold coins, not to mention the silver!”

segments.pli: “Atthi kho etaṃ, ugga, dhanaṃ netaṃ ‘natthī’ti vadāmīti.
segments.en: “Well, Ugga, that is wealth, I can’t deny it.

segments.pli: Tañca kho etaṃ, ugga, dhanaṃ sādhāraṇaṃ agginā udakena rājūhi corehi appiyehi dāyādehi.
segments.en: But fire, water, rulers, thieves, and unloved heirs all take a share of that wealth.

segments.pli: Satta kho imāni, ugga, dhanāni asādhāraṇāni agginā udakena rājūhi corehi appiyehi dāyādehi.
segments.en: There are these seven kinds of wealth that they can’t take a share of.
What seven?

segments.pli: Saddhādhanaṃ, sīladhanaṃ, hirīdhanaṃ, ottappadhanaṃ, sutadhanaṃ, cāgadhanaṃ, paññādhanaṃ.
segments.en: The wealth of faith, ethical conduct, conscience, prudence, learning, generosity, and wisdom.

segments.pli: Imāni kho, ugga, satta dhanāni asādhāraṇāni agginā udakena rājūhi corehi appiyehi dāyādehīti.
segments.en: There are these seven kinds of wealth that fire, water, rulers, thieves, and unloved heirs can’t take a share of.
Faith and ethical conduct are kinds of wealth,
as are conscience and prudence,
learning and generosity,
and wisdom is the seventh kind of wealth.
When a woman or man
has these kinds of wealth,
they’re really rich in the world,
invincible among gods and humans.
So let the wise devote themselves
to faith, ethical behavior,
confidence, and insight into the teaching,
remembering the instructions of the Buddhas.”

suttaplex.blurb: Migāra of Rohaṇa is a wealthy man, but even his riches are vulnerable to the vicissitudes of life, unlike spiritual wealth.
